title: Do You Need to Charge Your AirTag?

steps.title: No, AirTags do not need to be charged.
steps.content: No, AirTags do not need to be charged. AirTags are powered by a CR2032 battery that lasts for an entire year. CR2032 batteries are a coin-cell battery that are commonly used to power watches, calculators, toys, and many other electronic devices.

steps.title: Open the Find My app on your iPhone.
steps.content: Open the Find My app on your iPhone. When your AirTag's battery is near the end of its life, you'll receive a notification on your iPhone that says "AirTag Battery is Low." You can also check your AirTag's battery at any time in the Find My app. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap on the Items tab inside the app.
steps.content: Tap on the Items tab inside the app. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Select your AirTag.
steps.content: Select your AirTag. If you have multiple AirTags, they'll all be listed here. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Check the battery percentage.
steps.content: Check the battery percentage. There will be a battery icon underneath the AirTag's name, which will show an approximate reading of how much battery life the AirTag has left. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Unscrew the battery cover.
steps.content: Unscrew the battery cover. Press down on the stainless steel battery cover on your AirTag and rotate counterclockwise. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Lift the cover and remove the battery.
steps.content: Lift the cover and remove the battery. Like other single-use lithium batteries, it's best to recycle your AirTag's battery rather than throw it away. [6] X Trustworthy Source United States Environmental Protection Agency Independent U.S. government agency responsible for promoting safe environmental practices Go to source

steps.title: Insert a new CR2032 lithium 3V coin battery into the AirTag.
steps.content: Insert a new CR2032 lithium 3V coin battery into the AirTag. Make sure to use a battery that doesn't have a bitterant coating, as Apple instructs these batteries may not work in your AirTag. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Replace the cover.
steps.content: Replace the cover. Make sure the tabs on the battery cover align with the slots on your AirTag, then rotate the cover clockwise until it stops moving.
